On december 5, 2011
Laar
Jerry: They're really powerful skills that can be done only once a battle. You have to talk with Master Zenith (the dojo guy) first, then you have to talk to another person (depending on the race of your dino, you can see the list on the first page of this topic) to get the invocator skill, which allows you to unlock that special God skill, if you have the right two skills to do that (just like double skills). Hope that makes it clear.


Btw, there seems to be a trend of the skill hiding in one primary elementskill and one secundary elementskill for each dino... maybe that's where to search first

All invocation skills are of a new type: I (means Invocation)

This dinoz allow you to summon the god with which your dinoz has made a pact during a battle

On february 27, 2012
Nuke
I base my following post on the assumptions seen in Jenos post:
Tofufu are /, Wanwan are / and Winks are /.

Having found some of the elements already Jeno gives us a nice overview of the potential skills.
We know 20 (/26) of the elements that are used for Invocations. Ruling out Water and (due to the initial assumption) Lightning. The fire element has 5 dinoz, the wood element has 5 dinoz, and the water element has one.

Observe the dinoz we have yet to identify elements of: Kabuki, Moueffe, Sirain, Feross and (2/3rds of) Santaz.
This leaves us with a minimum of 10 skills with 9 elemental placements left.

Conclusion:
1) One of the unidentified invocations must have a repeated element, that makes it count for one less elements.
2) Or our information is faulty/incomplete.

Even if the initial assumptions are false, the conclusion seems accurate for as long as there is more than one dinoz that has a 3 skill requirement.

Either conclusion means that it is impossible to make educated guesses about what invocations belong to what elements.

Hi all,

I am one of the creators of the previous clan.

Last week I thought to introduce ourselves but time missing... So I do it now.
We are some French players to have dedicated our EN account to search missing invocations. We are now a big group.
To do that, regarding information we have on FR server, and regarding % of up for each element, we created plans for each race.
We first started with 3 members (creators) and decided to search first on moueffes, sirains and hippoclamps. We calculate that with 12 moueffes and sirains, if invocation is in the major element, it is enough to find it. We have 12 sirains and 12 moueffes growing and following these plans. So we hope found in few weeks/months invocations if nobody find it before.
Now we are a big group and decided to make plans for all other common races. In our presentation page, I sum up the number of plans needed to found the invocation (regarding some supposition) and the actual number of dinoz growing up for each race.
One of our members has 9 tufufu on 2 accounts (here and on DE server) and decided to dedicate them to this research!
We are not searching actually for Santaz, Kabuki (our accounts are too younger) and Feross (same reason as Kabuki^^). But maybe one day, or if someone is interesting here

I know that it is difficult to sacrifice some dinoz “to the science” on our principal account (that’s why we come here ), but if you are interested to participate, we are currently creating an external forum for people who does not want to come in our clan, or for FR players without EN account.
I will create an EN section in few days and translate our plans.

It is a very big work and it will probably need several months, maybe years for hippoclamps, but we thought that a “big” organization is the better way to find all missing invocations.

I hope I made few mistakes in my post

[884682]

or simply the developers have no idea how this game works, how the skills combine, etc..

examples:
- Temporal Manipulator (no comment)
- Beer (shuts down tons of items)
- Hypnosis (in the old days, permanent control)
- Bubble (as the effect)
- Bubble (as a powerful defense skill, which opens from the second most powerful defense skill. imagine if this would open from aweakening. less speed with greater defense: it wont be all powerful, but a choice to made)
- Tireless (this skill is really a double skill, with equal strength to overload, bubble, etc??
- Invocations - Fujin (Cloudoz)
- Invocations - Onedin (Sirain)
- element-independent spherical skills
- strength balance between the elements (water, lightning, fire = good, wood, air = crap)
- best spherical trio (10hp, liquid,flood) for the strongest element
- weakest spherical trio (acorn thrower, good whack) for the weakest
- Tear of Life in an environment where TM is common, and banishment is cheap
- rebalancing buble in a way that it wont affect the source problem (bubblewinks), but completelly ruining builds like bubble moueffe or glidwings (so decreasing the diversity of the dinoz used)

The only good idea behind Invocations is that they have to make special skills that are open only for certain races. Otherwise the players will choose the best skills (HP, group attacks, defense (bubble), immunities, speed and initiative) and after a little bit of thinking they will come out with using only 2-3 dinoz that have the best chance to acquire those skills (nowdays the biggest number of the best skills are accessible with the winks or the rocky)

I hope that there will be better skills for the other races (imagine a skill for gorilloz that would make it ignore the drawback of the giant and colossus skills, plus an other skill, that would make it hit every opponent with a wood assault! these two skills could bring the gorilloz back to business...

On april 20, 2012
Wobby

Sorry to tell you guys, but Ondine won't do 100 damage like D2K is predicting, but rather roughly 60-70 tops.

Typical Sirain will get roughly 35 Water as he said. After a certain point in Strength of attacks, for every time you double the Strength of the attack, the damage increases by 50%. This is clearly visible in Double Good Whacked compared to regular and Good Whack hits, as well as a Glidwings with Invocation. Regular lightning assault around 20 dmg, Lightning A skill does 30 dmg, and Raijin does roughly 45 dmg.

So, 35 Water with Flood and Underwater Karate does roughly 35 damage tops to other high leveled dinoz. Maybe 35 if the dinoz is really weak to Water. That flood has a strength of 360, Ondine would have a strength of 1060.

360 x 2 = 720
35 x 1.5 = 52.5
1060-720 = 340
340/720 = .47222 (Double power = x1.5 damage... so logic would dictate to cut this value by half)
.47222/2 = .236111
52.5(1 + .236111) = 64.6333

Obviously these calculations aren't exact, but it's a good way to estimate damage. Either way, I don't think it would ever do more than 75 dmg with 35 Water. IMHO Ondine is a great skill to combine with Banishment/TM + Without Mercy. If you trigger Ondine early on a non Bubble Target, and the rest of your dinoz carry strong Lightning Dances, you could have one of your opponents dinoz out in just a few turns.

EDIT: Sorry for the long wall of text lol.

On august 11, 2012
Bengeldorn

The skill Invocator is given to you by a NPC.
For each race, there is one NPC you can talk to to get the skill. There is no level limit, but the area in which the NPC is. You do not need to level up to get the skill - you get it directly after you talked to the NPC.

Once you have the Invoctor skill form the NPC, you can unlock the I-skill (Invocation/God-Skill), if you have the right combination of required skill on your dino.

The NPC and its location can be found here. There also the known combinations listed, that unlock the I-Skills.

For Example:
You have a Castivorus. You go to the Market Place and talk to Isabella. After the conversation you'll have the skill Invocator on your Castivorus.
If you also have Wild Instinct and Vivacious Wind on your Castivorus, you have the option to unlock Werewolf (I) with your next level up in or .
If you don't have both skills, you need to get them to be able to unlock Werewolf (I).
Once you have unlocked Werewolf (I), you can take it with the next level up in or .
